FuncDef: The display nat64 address-usage command displays the usage of public network ports in a NAT64 address pool.
CLIs: display nat64 address-usage instance <instance-name> address-group <group-name> [ slot <slot-id> { engine <cpu-id> | card <card-id> } ] [ verbose ]

ParaDef.Info:
Displays the usage of public network ports in a specified NAT64 address pool.
The value is a string of 1 to 31 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported. When double quotation marks are used around the string, spaces are allowed in the string.

Specifies the slot ID of a service board.
-

Specifies the CPU ID of a service board. This parameter takes effect only on a VSUF-80/VSUF-160/VSUI-160-E/VSUI-400/VSUI-400-E/VSUI-400A/VSUI-400A-E/VSUI-400-S/VSUI-400A-S.
The value can be 0 to 3.

Specifies the CPU ID of a subcard on a service board.
The value is an integer that ranges from 0 to 1.

Displays detailed information about the usage of public network ports in a NAT64 address pool.
-

Displays the usage of public network ports in a NAT64 address pool of a specified NAT64 instance.
The value is a string of 1 to 31 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported. When double quotation marks are used around the string, spaces are allowed in the string.

Examples: <HUAWEI> display nat64 address-usage instance nat1 address-group add-group1
This operation will take a few minutes. Press 'Ctrl+C' to break ...
<HUAWEI> display nat64 address-usage instance nat1 address-group add-group1 slot 1 engine 0 verbose
This operation will take a few minutes. Press 'Ctrl+C' to break ...
ExtraInfo: To view the usage of public network ports in a NAT64 address pool, run the display nat64 address-usage command. To view detailed information, configure the verbose parameter in the preceding command.
